intro: Dipterotheca kotschyi, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, large showy flowers, and palmate leaves. It is well adapted to drought conditions, with thick, fleshy leaves that help reduce water loss. Dipterotheca kotschyi is often used in traditional medicine and as an ornamental plant in dry landscapes.
